abstract: When I turn on my Windows XP computer, the folder C:\windows\system32 opens automatically every time. Why is this and how do I stop it?
snippet: When I turn on my Windows XP computer, the folder C:\windows\system32 opens automatically every time. Why is this and how do I stop it?
lead_paragraph: Q. When I turn on my Windows XP computer, the folder C:\windows\system32 opens automatically every time. Why is this and how do I stop it?

abstract: Microsoft plans to offer a stripped-down version of Windows, Office and other software for $3 to people in developing nations.
snippet: Microsoft plans to offer a stripped-down version of Windows, Office and other software for $3 to people in developing nations.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to expand its global reach in computing, Microsoft plans to offer a stripped-down version of Windows, Office and other software for $3 to people in developing nations.

headline.main: Software by Microsoft Is Nearly Free for the Needy
headline.print_headline: Software By Microsoft Is Nearly Free For the Needy

abstract: Transferring files is one thing, but software is another matter altogether.
snippet: Transferring files is one thing, but software is another matter altogether.
lead_paragraph: BUYING a new computer is a lot like buying or renting a new home. First you have to pick it out and pay for it, and then you have to move your stuff. And as if PC moving day weren’t hard enough, most people now faced with this task have to migrate from an older version of Windows to the new Windows Vista, which typically stores user files in different folders from previous versions.

headline.main: Moving Day for That Vista Machine
headline.print_headline: Moving Day for That Vista Machine
